View this page

Visualization Utilities¶

Visual helpers under visualization provide plotting routines for explaining recommendation pathways. The modules below document the available tree plotting interfaces and configuration knobs.

Visualization utilities for Grail Simulation reports.

Facade module exposing recommendation tree visualisation helpers.

class visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.GraphCounts(node=<factory>, edge=<factory>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Container for per-node and per-edge traversal counts.

Parameters:

  • node (Mapping[str, int])

  • edge (Mapping[Tuple[str, str], int])

node¶

Mapping of node identifiers to visit counts.

Type:

Mapping[str, int]

edge¶

Mapping of (parent, child) identifiers to traversal counts.

Type:

Mapping[Tuple[str, str], int]

edge: Mapping[Tuple[str, str], int]¶
node: Mapping[str, int]¶
class visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.GraphRenderOptions(metadata=<factory>, label_template='{originTitle}', wrap_width=None, highlight_path=<factory>, counts=<factory>, max_depth=None, style=<factory>)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration parameters for rendering tree-level graphs.

Parameters:

  • metadata (Mapping[str, Mapping[str, object]])

  • label_template (str)

  • wrap_width (int | None)

  • highlight_path (Sequence[str])

  • counts (visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphCounts)

  • max_depth (int | None)

  • style (visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphStyle)

metadata¶

External node metadata keyed by node id.

Type:

Mapping[str, Mapping[str, object]]

label_template¶

Template used to render node labels.

Type:

str

wrap_width¶

Optional wrapping width for node labels.

Type:

int | None

highlight_path¶

Ordered identifiers describing the highlight path.

Type:

Sequence[str]

counts¶

Per-node and per-edge traversal counts.

Type:

visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphCounts

max_depth¶

Optional maximum depth for tree rendering.

Type:

int | None

style¶

Graphviz styling options shared across the graph.

Type:

visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphStyle

counts: visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphCounts¶
highlight_path: Sequence[str]¶
label_template: str = '{originTitle}'¶
max_depth: int | None = None¶
metadata: Mapping[str, Mapping[str, object]]¶
style: visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphStyle¶
wrap_width: int | None = None¶
class visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.GraphStyle(rankdir='LR', engine='dot', show_rank_labels=True)[source]¶

Bases: object

Graphviz style attributes shared across tree renders.

Parameters:

  • engine (str)

  • show_rank_labels (bool)

rankdir¶

Graph orientation (LR, TB, etc.).

Type:

str

engine¶

Graphviz layout engine name.

Type:

str

show_rank_labels¶

Whether to attach rank labels to edges.

Type:

bool

engine: str = 'dot'¶
rankdir: str = 'LR'¶
show_rank_labels: bool = True¶

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.aggregate_counts(sequences)[source]¶

Aggregate node and edge visitation counts from viewer trajectories.

Parameters:

sequences (Iterable[Sequence[str]]) – Iterable of viewer identifier sequences.

Returns:

Tuple (node_counts, edge_counts) with visit tallies.

Return type:

Tuple[collections.Counter, collections.Counter]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.build_graph(tree, options)[source]¶

Render a recommendation tree as a Graphviz graph.

Parameters:

  • tree (visualization.recommendation_tree.models.TreeData) – Structured tree data assembled from CSV exports.

  • options (visualization.recommendation_tree.render.GraphRenderOptions) – Rendering configuration controlling style and filtering.

Returns:

A Graphviz graph ready to be rendered to disk.

Return type:

graphviz.Digraph

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.build_session_graph(rows, options)[source]¶

Visualise a single viewer session as a Graphviz graph.

Parameters:

  • rows (Sequence[Mapping[str, object]]) – Ordered dataset rows describing the viewer session.

  • options (visualization.recommendation_tree.render.SessionGraphOptions) – Rendering configuration controlling styling choices.

Returns:

A Graphviz graph representing the session timeline.

Return type:

graphviz.Digraph

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.collect_rows(dataset, split=None, issue=None)[source]¶

Collect dataset rows, optionally filtering by split name and issue.

Parameters:

  • dataset – HuggingFace dataset or mapping of splits to datasets.

  • split (str | None) – Optional split name to filter.

  • issue (str | None) – Optional issue identifier to filter.

Returns:

List of dataset rows matching the filters.

Return type:

List[Dict[str, object]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.compute_depths(tree)[source]¶

Compute the depth (distance from the root) for every node in a tree.

Parameters:

tree (visualization.recommendation_tree.models.TreeData) – Parsed recommendation tree data structure.

Returns:

Mapping of node identifiers to their distance from the root.

Return type:

Dict[str, int]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.extract_session_rows(dataset, *, session_id, split, issue, max_steps)[source]¶

Extract the rows that correspond to a target viewer session.

Parameters:

  • dataset – HuggingFace dataset or mapping of splits to datasets.

  • session_id (str | None) – Optional specific session identifier to select.

  • split (str | None) – Optional dataset split name.

  • issue (str | None) – Optional issue filter.

  • max_steps (int | None) – Optional maximum number of steps to return.

Returns:

Tuple of resolved session identifier and the matching rows.

Raises:

ValueError – If no rows or matching session can be found.

Return type:

Tuple[str, List[Dict[str, object]]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.format_node_label(node_id, *, node_data, options)[source]¶

Render a node label based on the configured template.

Parameters:

  • node_id (str)

  • node_data (Mapping[str, object])

  • options (visualization.recommendation_tree.models.LabelRenderOptions)

Return type:

str

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.group_rows_by_session(rows)[source]¶

Group dataset rows by session identifier and sort within each session.

Parameters:

rows (Sequence[Mapping[str, object]]) – Sequence of dataset rows.

Returns:

Mapping from session identifier to sorted row list.

Return type:

Dict[str, List[Mapping[str, object]]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_cleaned_dataset(path)[source]¶

Load a HuggingFace dataset exported by clean_data.py.

Parameters:

path (pathlib.Path) – Path to the dataset directory or file.

Returns:

HuggingFace dataset object.

Raises:

  • ImportError – If the datasets package is not available.

  • ValueError – If the file extension is unsupported.

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_metadata(metadata_path, *, id_column='originId')[source]¶

Load per-node metadata to enrich node labels.

Parameters:

  • metadata_path (pathlib.Path | None) – Optional path to JSON/CSV metadata.

  • id_column (str) – Identifier column used to index rows.

Returns:

Mapping of identifier to metadata rows.

Raises:

ValueError – If the identifier column is missing in tabular inputs.

Return type:

Dict[str, Mapping[str, object]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_trajectories(path, *, delimiter=',')[source]¶

Load viewer trajectories from text, CSV, or JSON representations.

Parameters:

  • path (pathlib.Path | None) – Optional path to a trajectories file.

  • delimiter (str) – Delimiter used for plain-text trajectory files.

Returns:

List of normalised identifier sequences.

Return type:

List[List[str]]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.load_tree_csv(csv_path, *, id_column='originId', child_prefixes=('rec',))[source]¶

Load a recommendation tree from a CSV export.

Parameters:

  • csv_path (pathlib.Path) – Path to the CSV file describing the tree.

  • id_column (str) – Column holding the node identifier.

  • child_prefixes (Sequence[str]) – Column prefixes pointing to recommendation children.

Returns:

Parsed TreeData ready for rendering.

Return type:

visualization.recommendation_tree.models.TreeData

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.main(argv=None)[source]¶

Entry point for the recommendation tree visualiser.

Parameters:

argv (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional CLI argument list; defaults to sys.argv.

Return type:

None

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.parse_args(argv=None)[source]¶

Parse CLI arguments for the recommendation visualiser.

Parameters:

argv (Sequence[str] | None) – Optional CLI argument list; defaults to sys.argv when None.

Returns:

Parsed argument namespace ready for execution.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.parse_issue_counts(spec)[source]¶

Parse comma-separated issue=count specifications into a mapping.

Parameters:

spec (str) – Raw specification string (e.g. "issue_a=2,issue_b=1").

Returns:

Mapping of issue names to target counts.

Raises:

ValueError – If any chunk is missing an issue, count, or is invalid.

Return type:

Dict[str, int]

visualization.recommendation_tree_viz.render_graph(graph, output_path, *, output_format)[source]¶

Render a Graphviz graph to disk, normalising the output path.

Parameters:

  • graph (graphviz.Digraph) – Graphviz graph to render.

  • output_path (pathlib.Path) – Destination path (suffix controls format when unspecified).

  • output_format (str | None) – Explicit Graphviz format override.

Returns:

Path to the final rendered artefact.

Return type:

pathlib.Path

Dataclasses and formatting helpers for recommendation tree visualisations.

Collect dataset rows, optionally filtering by split name and issue.

Parameters:

  • split (str | None) – Optional split name to filter.

  • issue (str | None) – Optional issue identifier to filter.

  • session_id (str | None) – Optional specific session identifier to select.

  • split (str | None) – Optional dataset split name.

  • issue (str | None) – Optional issue filter.

  • max_steps (int | None) – Optional maximum number of steps to return.

Returns:

Raises:
